description: From Middle English meningli, menyngli, equivalent to meaning +â€Ž -ly.

adverbs.description: meaningly (comparative more meaningly, superlative most meaningly)

entries.meaning: With an implied meaning; with significance; meaningfully.
examples: Ada opened the album at one of its maroon markers meaningly inserted here and there, glanced once, reclicked the clasp, handed the grinning blackmailer a thousand-dollar note that she happened to have in her bag, summoned Bouteillan and told him to throw Kim out.
